zone.line: you; by your former love for me
now last lost, answer I adjure you
to answer that one question. Am I
the cause of your grief?"
He raised his eyes from the ground,
but still turning them away from me,
said: "Besought by that plea I will
answer your rash question. Yes, you
are the sole, the agonizing cause of
all I suffer, of all I must suffer lill
untill I die. Now, beware! Be silent!
Do not urge me to your destruction. I
am struck by the storm, rooted up, laid
waste: but you can stand against
it; you are young and your passions
are at peace. One word I might spe
speak and then you would be implica
ted in my destruction; as if when an
vulture is carrying off some hare in
it is struck by an arrow his helpless
victim is kille entangled in the same
fate is killed by N the defeat of its
enemy â€“ One word would do all this
